title: Edward Ewart
text:
Edwart Ewart (2 August 1860 – 26 April 1935) was a <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
He played for <a href="Glasgow%20Academicals%20RFC">Glasgow Academicals</a>. He left Scotland in 1884 to go the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> after his mother died in 1883. He joined his older brother who had set up a farm in Oregon.
Provincial career.
He played for <a href="Glasgow%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Glasgow District</a> in their inter-city match against <a href="Edinburgh%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Edinburgh District</a> on 1 December 1877.
He played for <a href="Blues%20Trial">Blues Trial</a> in their match against <a href="Whites%20Trial">Whites Trial</a> on 16 February 1878. This trial match was to try and impress the Scotland international side selectors.
He played for <a href="West%20of%20Scotland%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">West of Scotland District</a> in their match against <a href="East%20of%20Scotland%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">East of Scotland District</a> on 1 March 1879.
International career.
He was capped three times for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> between 1879 and 1880 spanning the <a href="1879%20Home%20Nations%20Championship">1879 Home Nations Championship</a> and the <a href="1880%20Home%20Nations%20Championship">1880 Home Nations Championship</a>.
